title.narrative: 5. HEALTH SYSTEM STRENGTHENING FOR MNCAH

description.narrative: By 2022, the health system has capacity to produce and use quality data to develop result-, equity- and gender-based plans and budgets, manage health procurement appropriately and respond effectively to emergencies., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, Women of childbearing age, pregnant women, newborns, boys and girls under age 5 years and adolescents use quality health services at health facilities and in communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the health system has capacity to produce and use quality data to develop result-, equity- and gender-based plans andbudgets, manage health procurement appropriately and respond effectively to emergencies.

description.narrative: Through technical and financial support and in collaboration with other partners, UNICEF reinforced the nationwide implementation universal health care.; A total of 3.9million children under the age of 5 and 1.06 million pregnant women received free healthcare, including 6,969,652 new consultations for children and 513,788 deliveries.;UNICEF supported the MoH in the evaluation of the of the National Health Development Plan 2011-2020 (PNDS 20211-202), the development of the PNDS 2021-2030 and other child-sensitive policies and strategic documents, delivery of free access to healthcare for children under-five and pregnant women, results-based management, and evidence generation for decision making.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022
